page.title: 17Clarendon Estate, Laverstock
page.content: The Clarendon Estate occupies more than 75% of this 4 by 3 Km. block. {There are 5000 acres of land and some {14 miles of track road on the Estate which give access for four gamekeepers to look after the Estate's interests. Nearly half of the Estate is put to forest, both decidious and coniferous type. Three tenanted farms use 50% of the land for mixed crop farming of Barley, Maize, Oats, Rape, Wheat and Turnip for dairy herds. Over three Km. squares the fields are surrounded by regular lines of decidious trees giving a very regimented pattern to the land cover. This does have the effect of providing shelter for the crops from the winter north east winds which cut over the area. However the prime reason is to provide for natural shelter to the young partridges and pheasants which the Estate breeds.
